Sentencas: Samples of the solid oxide fuel cell cathode material La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-delta (LSCF) were annealed using High-Temperature Environmental Scanning Electron Microscopy (HT-ESEM) from room temperature to 1000 degrees C in atmospheres of pure oxygen, pure water and ambient lab air.
Titulo: In situ study of strontium segregation in La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ in ambient atmospheres using high-temperature environmental scanning electron microscopy

Sentencas: Image series of each heat treatment were taken where microstructural changes were observed and compared between samples.
Titulo: In situ study of strontium segregation in La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ in ambient atmospheres using high-temperature environmental scanning electron microscopy

Sentencas: Strontium segregation rate was found to be significantly increased in the presence of pure water as compared to pure O-2 and ambient air.
Titulo: In situ study of strontium segregation in La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ in ambient atmospheres using high-temperature environmental scanning electron microscopy

Sentencas: Electron backscattered diffraction (EBSD) was performed in order to assess the effect of crystal orientation on particle formation and surface sensitive chemical analysis techniques were used to determine the chemical changes at the grain surface as a result of the different heat treatments.
Titulo: In situ study of strontium segregation in La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ in ambient atmospheres using high-temperature environmental scanning electron microscopy

Sentencas: It was shown that crystal orientation affected the nature and growth rate of strontium-based particles, however, due to the pseudo-symmetry of La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-delta, precise crystal orientation relationships could not be determined.
Titulo: In situ study of strontium segregation in La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ in ambient atmospheres using high-temperature environmental scanning electron microscopy

Sentencas: The chemical composition of the grain surface was found to be approximately equal under each atmosphere.
Titulo: In situ study of strontium segregation in La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ in ambient atmospheres using high-temperature environmental scanning electron microscopy
